Text: Read more about the Congressional Accountability and Hush Fund Elimination Act, which I've cosponsored with 33 other members of the U.S. House  #mepoliticshttps://pingree.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/pingree-pushes-bill-end-taxpayer-funded-secret-harassment-settlements …

Buying silence w/ taxpayer money is flat-out corrupt. It’s sad that we need an act of Congress to get to the bottom of these secret settlements and hold perpetrators accountable, but apparently that’s what it takes. #mepoliticshttps://twitter.com/chelliepingree/status/936274550861565952 …

In light of reports that Congress has spent $17 million in order to settle 260 harassment scandals, I've cosponsored a bill to eliminate this unethical hush fund, ensure taxpayers know how their money was spent & require that the public be paid back w/ interest. #mepolitics

.@RealDonaldTrump, it's beneath the office of the President to retweet hate-filled, hoax-laden messages, and counterproductive to unilaterally rupture relations with our closest ally, the UK. Foreign policy is not a reality show.http://www.pressherald.com/?p=1295109

I urge @SpeakerRyan to bring the bipartisan #MeToo bill to the floor so we can begin reform a system that has for too long shielded the powerful from consequences. #mepolitics

Making this training mandatory is an important first step in changing the culture of Congress, but we must also urgently reform the Office of Compliance so that accountability, transparency, and safety are upheld for every single person who works here. #mepolitics

I’ve co-sponsored legislation to make harassment training mandatory for members, staff and officers and voted in favor of H. Res 630 today b/c everyone deserves to be treated w/ dignity in the workforce. #mepolitics

As women and minorities in the workforce have long known, harassment and discrimination are pervasive in every industry. This systemic abuse of power is deeply wrong and continues to go unchecked in professional environments where victims are disempowered. #mepolitics
Just voted in favor of H. Res 630 to mandate workforce harassment training in Congress, but it's far from enough to reform the culture of secrecy & predatory behavior here. #mepolitics

READ: My full statement detailing why I voted against the #GOPTaxPlan today #mepoliticshttps://pingree.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/pingree-votes-against-house-republican-tax-plan …

And don't forget the unfunded tax cut in the #GOPTaxBiill adds $1.5 trillion to the nat'l debt—which, under sequestration, would automatically trigger $25 billion in cuts to Medicare. Hard-working #Maine families deserve much better than what this plan has to offer. #mepolitics

For some, harmful impacts of the #GOPTaxPlan will come immediately, in the form of repealing important deductions that offer relief to graduates, teachers, those with high medical expenses, & many others. #mepolitics

For the wealthiest of the wealthy, tax cuts under the #GOPTaxPlan get bigger and bigger every year, while they get smaller and smaller for everyone else. At the end of 10 years, many middle-class Mainers will actually be paying more in taxes. #mepolitics

I’m incredibly disappointed to see the House pass the #GOPTaxBill. I support tax reform that helps our small businesses & working families, but this is not that kind of plan—not by a long shot. #mepolitics

Jonathan Brown graduated from college in #Maine in 2016 & was planning to use the student loan interest deduction this yr, like 12 Million other middle-class Americans. Currently, people can claim up to $2,500 of student loan interest. #GOPTaxScam ends this deduction. #mepoliticspic.twitter.com/y8PKaMAHiz

Sue Clifford of Freeport, who survived breast cancer, is just one of nearly 10 million Americans who utilize the medical expense deduction each yr. It is especially important to Americans age 50+. #GOPTaxScam would end that deduction for middle-class Americans. #mepoliticspic.twitter.com/47uYO0p507

#GOPTaxScam eliminates Section 199 deduction for dairy & other farm cooperatives. According to @FarmerCoop this deduction is valued at $1 billion per year & eliminating it could raise farms taxes by 5 to 17 percent. This would be devastating for #Maine farmers. #mepoliticshttps://twitter.com/chelliepingree/status/930098552772145152 …
Under #GOPTaxScam, #Maine farms could take a hit because the Section 199 Waiver is eliminated in GOP plan, says Bob Wellington of Agri-Mark Dairy Cooperative. #mepoliticspic.twitter.com/4tD7hVE6bL

Nancy Smith of @growsmartmaine says: loss of Historic Tax Credits will be a huge economic hit in #Maine. Since 2008, this tax credit has yielded 5,180 new jobs in #Maine & generated $42.2 Million in revenue. #mepoliticspic.twitter.com/ng5fi7tVTo

Barbara Berry of @mainerealtors says: Loss of mortgage interest deduction will have consequences for #Maine homeowners. Home values will go down under #GOPtaxplan & incentives for homeownership will be reduced for middle-class Mainers. #mepoliticspic.twitter.com/8w5QHss4Q7

Sally Reagan, a teacher at #Portland High School, like 99.5% of public school teachers spends her own money on classroom supplies & equipment. Currently, teachers can get a tax break for what they spend on supplies. #GOPTaxScam would eliminate that deduction. #mepoliticspic.twitter.com/n8PDxkZypb
